characters: "I THINK THAT YOUR DOCTRINE MEANS THE END
LADY ASKS FOR MR. SMITH PLEASE TELL HER
PROFESSION KNOW WHAT A BLESSING THIS
OF A CRYING BABY, SARAH'S LIFE BECAME A
THE UNITED STATES ALONE, CAUSING THE
WORK. FOR THE SAKE OF OUR CHILDREN
INTO THIS HOUSE, I LEAVE IT--I'M
SARAH, TO BE AT KERNAN'S HALL NEXT
OF HARD TIMES AND THE ETERNAL REPETITION
ON A HIGHER PLANE IS MET WITH SCATHING
SINCE YOUR ARREST BECAUSE OF THE
I WISH TO WARN YOU THAT THE LAW WILL
I HAVE BEEN SO THANKFUL FOR YOUR HELP,
HE WILL PARDON YOU ON YOUR GUARANTEE
WEAKENED HER AND FORCED MRS. BROOME'S
"I THINK IT IS TOO BIG A QUESTION FOR ME
THIS RESPECT ALONE NATURE HAS BEEN
AND WE WOULD LEAP CENTURIES AHEAD IN
QUESTION THAT SHOULD NOT BE DISCUSSED IN
THAT YOU WILL GIVE UP YOUR PUBLIC
THE DOCTOR TELLS ME THAT YOU RELEASED
WERE WANTED WOULD BE BORN WITH SELF CONTROL
FOR YOUR HUSBAND'S SAKE AND REPUTATION,
NATURE TO FURTHER HIS ADVANCEMENT IN
AND PRISONS BEAR GHASTLY TESTIMONY TO
BEAR THE CHILDREN THEY WOULD CHANGE THE
BUT I LONG TO HELP OTHERS. IF IT WASN'T
FOR MY PROMISE TO YOU, I WOULD TELL THE
THE NERVE WRACKING PERIOD OF TRIAL
"I THINK IT IS A PURELY PERSONAL QUESTION
AS A BIRTHRIGHT. IT WOULD MEAN A NEW RACE
ME FROM CUSTODY BECAUSE HE MADE HIMSELF
DO THAT, NOR WILL I MAKE ANY PROMISES.
SINCE AND I SHALL NEVER LIVE WITH HIM
OPERATIONS ARE PERFORMED IN A YEAR IN
SHE WILL PROMISE NOT TO OFFEND AGAIN."
HAS ENDEAVORED TO DIRECT THE FORCES OF
SUPERSTITION BARS THE WAY TO A REMEDY
HER HUSBAND AND SARAH'S IMPERILED FUTURE
YOU TO YIELD AND END THE TORTURE FOR
KNOWLEDGE WOULD BE TO WOMEN AND YET YOU
WITH HER STORY I SAW MY DUTY CLEARLY."
THE NEED OF DRASTIC REFORM IN THIS
I REGRET THAT I CANNOT PERMIT HIM TO
EVERY WAY BUT ONE--THE MOST IMPORTANT
AND SLAUGHTER, ANY ATTEMPT TO PUT IT
AS SHE HAS IT TOO HARD, BEING A
I HAVE JUST COME FROM THE GOVERNOR.
UNDER THE AGE OF FIVE YEARS, AND THE
YOU MIND IF I HELP HER
NOTHING IN LAW TO PREVENT IT HE
AND SHE HAS TO TAKE IN WASHING TO HELP
HAVE TO TAKE ITS COURSE IF YOU DEFY IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man comes on and enters the saloon as  John comes out with another man--he  exits--two men enter saloon--
Sarah disc hushing the child--sits  down in rocker sings and rocks the  child--
John enters--takes off his coat--takes  off his vest and hat--hangs them up-- starts to wind the clock--
Sarah rocking the baby--she looks off  and speaks--
Johns looks up the stairs and answers --winding the clock--
Sarah rises--goes to door--
John disc winding the clock--blows out  the light--he exits up the stairs--
Sarah disc with the children--she comes  to f.g.--sits down--John enters closes  the door--sits down on the bed-- stretches--starts to take off his shoes--
Child disc--starts to cry--
Sarah and John disc--she rises--baby  in her arms--goes to the crib--
Child disc mother comes on--speaks--turns--
Father disc scolding the other child--
Baby crying--
John disc scolding the child on the small  bed--boy sits up--crying--
Mother disc holding baby--tries to quiet  the baby--lays the sleeping child down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and men disc--other men come from  building in b.g.--employment bureau sign  at the edge of sidewalk--man takes out  money--shows to John--
Sarah disc with the children--boy in f.g.  holding the baby--girl enters--shows a  torn stocking--Sarah scolds the child--
Men disc--two rise and exit--
Two men disc--John and his friends come  on--enter the saloon--others exit--
Sarah and children disc--she comes to  f.g. gives pail to girl--
John and his friends come out--talk-- man smoking cigar--three exit--others  come on--

Little girl comes out with the pail-- followed by Sarah--girl exits--Sarah  looks after her--John and the man come  on--man speaks to Sarah--she speaks to  John--other children come out of the  house--two come to f.g.
He speaks--
One crying--pulling away from the other--
Looks around--shakes his head--talking-- says--

Sarah, John and the man disc--children  about--Sarah speaks to the children-- they start to enter--she goes on the  porch--the man speaks to John and  exits--John looks at Sarah--nods-- she exits--he follows her--IRIS CLOSES--
IRIS OPENS--Sarah walking the floor with  the baby--children in bed--
John disc--puts his hands over his head--
Sarah trying to hush the baby--John  restless--child crying--
Sarah trying to quiet the baby--John  speaks to her--scolds--lies down and  covers his head--
Trying to quiet the baby--looks up--shakes  her head--

Sarah trying to quiet baby--boy sits up-- storms at his mother--John sits up and  scolds her--she shakes her head--sits  down on the bed--another child sits up-- John gets out of bed--picks up comfort  and pillows--opens the door--says as  title--
John, Sarah and the children disc--John storming at her--he exits down the  stairs--boy gets out of bed--
John comes down the stairs--puts the  pillow and comfort on a chair--strikes  a match and lights the gas--John picks  up sofa pillows--
John disc looking at picture of himself  and Sarah--he says as title--
John looking at the picture--exits--
John disc--comes to f.g.--starts to make  up a bed on the chairs--
Sarah and the children disc--trying to  quiet them--Sarah frantic--one child  exits--
John disc--turns out the light--lies  down on the chairs--covers up-
Sarah disc trying to quiet the crying  children--two lie down--boy comes on--exits--
Sarah seated on the bed--children lying  down--
John disc--shakes his fist and storms--
Mother disc--rises and closes the door--
John lying on the chairs--draws the  covers over him-
Sarah disc holding the baby--leaning  against the door--puts her hand on the  baby's mouth--tries to smother its  cries--tears streaming down her face--

IRIS OPENS--Lois, Priscilla and the two  men disc--Lois talking--George yawns-- bored--doctor goes toward b.g.--Priscilla  looks at Lois--men bored--Lois looks at  the doctor--talks to Priscilla--Lois says  as title--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois disc with two children--Sarah comes  on in b.g. with baby--calls--Lois sees  her--Sarah exits--
Lois and children disc--Lois rises as  Sarah comes on with the baby--Doris  takes the baby--the two women exit-- little boy with a puppy--Doris sits  down with the baby--
The two women come on in b.g.--toward  chairs in f.g.--Sarah sobbing--they sit  down--Lois questions her--Sarah talks--
Crying--Lois' hand comes on--pats her  shoulder--
Lois and Sarah disc seated--Lois trying  to comfort Sarah--
Doris disc holding the baby--her brother  with the puppy--they talk--
Lois and Sarah disc--Lois put her arm  about her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene in the bedroom appears--John  exits with the pillow and comfort--Sarah  seated on the bed--boy comes on--

dialogues.speaker: ORIGINAL SCENE--
dialogues.text: The two women seated in the chairs  talking--
Doris and the boy disc with the baby--
Sarah and Lois seated in chairs-- talking--Lois clasps Sarah's hand-- Sarah's kisses Lois' hand--
Doris and brother disc--they exit with  the baby--

Sarah and Lois disc--they rise as the  children come on with the baby--Sarah  takes baby--boy talks to his mother-- Doris talking to Sarah-kisses her-- Sarah exits in f.g.--comes on again in  b.g.--children talk to Lois--Sarah  exits--Lois talking--FADE OUT--
FADE IN--Lois, Priscilla and the two men  disc --Lois talking--doctor goes to b.g. --George rises--bored--takes out cigaret  case--doctor comes to Lois--she says as  title--

The four disc--George bored--Lois talking --Lois looks after him as he goes to b.g. --George exits--doctor goes to the door-- looks back at Lois--exits--Priscilla  rises--sits down at the piano--starts to  play--
George comes on--sits down--doctor comes  on--George offers a cigarette to the  doctor--doctor refuses it--George closes  the case--puts it away--doctor thoughtful --they talk--
George talking to the doctor--doctor looks  off--thoughtful--doctor speaks--
The two men disc talking--George looks off--
Lois and Priscilla disc talking--Priscilla  talks to Lois--looks up at her--
The two women talking--Lois answers--looks  off as she talks--says as title--
The two women talking--Priscilla smiles-- turns and starts to play--Lois leans against  the end of the piano--smiles at her--

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: (END OF REEL THREE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (REEL FOUR)
Doctor disc--Lois enters with little boy --and Doris--they greet doctor good  morning--they all sit down at table--
The four disc at table--maid enters--starts  to serve--Doris hands Lois a letter--maid  serves the children--Lois opening mail-- children start to eat--
Lois disc reading letter--

dialogues.speaker: FOR MY PROMISE TO YOU, I WOULD TELL THE
dialogues.text: WOMAN NEXT DOOR (the page is turned  disclosed the other page which reads):
Reading the second page of letter--she  looks off--picks up cream pitcher--sets it  on other side--speaks off--
He leans forward--
She hands him the letter--
Taking letter--he looks at it--looks off-- speaks--reads letters--
Watching off--
He folds letter--looks off--speaks--
Talking--shakes her head--
The four disc at table--Lois talking to  doctor--
Looks off--talks--
Letter in hand--he looks around--
The four disc--doctor hands letter to  Lois--children eating--Lois shakes her  head--
Clenches his fist--talks--
Looks off--looks one way--then other--
Nods his head--starts to eat--
The four disc at table--eating--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief disc with letter in his hand-- goes to door--then toward his desk--
Nurse enters with woman, doctor and  child--nurse puts hat on girl's head-- starts to exit--
Chief disc--sits down at desk--lays down  the letter--picks up phone--talks--

Doctor, women & girl disc with nurse--doctor   turns and talks to nurse who goes to b.g.--  doctor talks to woman who puts her hands on  child--leads her around desk--door in b.g. is opened disclosed other patients--mother & child go into the outer office followed by  nurse--door is closed--doctor picks up  phone--
Talking over phone--
Doctor disc talking over phone--
Talking over phone--says--
Talking over phone--
Doctor disc talking over phone--
Chief disc--picks up letter--reads it--
Chief disc reading the letter over the  phone-lays it down--
Doctor talking over phone--
Chief disc talking over phone--
Doctor talking over phone--
Chief disc talking over phone--
Doctor talking over phone--hangs up--
Chief disc talking over phone--hangs  up--picks up cigar--
Chief disc--Crittenden enters--starts to  exit-Chief hands him letter--Crittenden  reads it--talks--he hands him back the  letter--opens door--exits--closes door--
Doctor disc--worried--exits--
Limousine in f.g.--woman follows  chauffeur up steps to house--they exit--
Chauffeur comes on--rings bell--woman  comes on--he exits--she looks after  him--door is opened--woman enters--door  is closed--
Maid comes on followed by woman--Lois  comes down stairs in b.g.--maid looks  off--Lois comes on again in f.g.--maid  exits--Lois & woman talk--
Crittenden comes on motorcycle around  corner--stops at curb--looks around--
Crittenden disc beside motorcycle at  curb--he crosses over and goes toward  drive--limousine standing on drive--
Crittenden disc looking from behind post--
Lois & woman disc--Lois takes letter from  her muff--hands it to woman who sits down  on piano stool--reads--
The two disc--woman turns the page of  the letter and reads--
The two women disc--one reading letter-- talks to Lois--who talks--woman rises-- Lois takes the letter--the two women exit--
Crittenden disc watching off--draws back--

Crittenden disc standing beside post at  entrance to drive--the two women enter  limousine in b.g.--chauffeur takes his  place--the auto drives to f.g. & exits --Crittenden watching--he runs to his  motorcycle--exits with it--
Auto in f.g.--doctor comes out of house --down steps--comes to f.g.--gets into  auto--auto exits--
Taken from moving auto--Limousine disc  coming to f.g. followed by motorcycle  with Crittenden--

Doctor enters--calls off--Doris & little  boy comes from b.g. to the doctor--he  embraces & kisses them--little boy talks  to him about his top--he takes the string  & top--starts to fix it for the boy--
Limousine disc coming to f.g.--it exits --motorcycle comes on in distance--it  comes to f.g.--
Crittenden disc riding toward f.g.-- stops--looks over fence--
Children on porch--limousine comes on in  f.g.--stops--footman alights--goes around  car--
Children disc pointing off--Sarah comes  out of house--
The two women inside--they alight from  car--CAMERA PAMS disclosing Sarah &  children on porch in b.g.--Lois & woman  go up toward them--
Sarah & children disc--Lois & woman come  on--woman is introduced to Sarah--
Doctor & children disc--doctor spins  top for them--they watch it--delighted  --doctor talks to them--
The three women & children disc--talking --they start to go around the house-- Sarah points off--talks to Lois--

Woman disc taking clothes from line-- baby in arms--child playing in clothes  basket on ground--woman starts to cough --child pulls at her skirts--woman  motions off--boy comes on--moves basket --mother puts baby into basket--children  bend over it--mother clutches at line-- coughing--
The three women disc watching off-- Sarah says--
Sarah disc talking to Lois & woman--Lois  looks at her friend--she turns--they go  toward b.g.--start to exit--
Lois & friend come on followed by Sarah  & children--little boy exits--Sarah  talks to little girl--Lois & woman  talking--
Crittenden disc looking over fence--
The 3 women disc with children--Lois nods  her head--talks--puts her hand on Sarah --says--
The 3 women disc--Lois talking to Sarah --her friend pats Lois on hand--Sarah  says she will--Lois & her friend exit-- Sarah looks after them--
Lois & friend coming toward it--Sarah &  children watching from steps--Lois &  friend get into car--footman comes on  in f.g.--takes his place--car exits-- Sarah looks after it--
Crittenden disc--rides to f.g. & exits--
Doctor & two children disc--girls  spinning top--doctor looks at his watch --exits into drawing room--
Limousine comes on in f.g.--stops-- footman opens the door--caller alights--
Lois, her friend & footman disc--woman  says good-bye--door is closed--footman  exits--
Footman comes around car to his place-- the car exits--the woman is seen going  up the steps--
Children in b.g. in hall--doctor in f.g. --pacing up and down--
Limousine comes on in f.g.--footman  opens door--Lois alights--she goes up  stairs to house--footman steps on  running board-auto exits--Lois exits-- CAMERA PAMS disclosing Crittenden  watching--
Doctor in f.g.--children in b.g.--Lois  enters-doctor turns--she comes to him-- talks to him --he turns and talks to  her--children spinning top in b.g.--
Crittenden disc on motorcycle--he exits--
Doctor & Lois in f.g. talking--children  in b.g. playing--doctor points off as  he talks--she talks--says--

Lois disc talking to doctor in f.g.-- children in b.g. playing--Lois clasps  her hands--he puts his hand on her-- talks to her--she answers him--he passes  her--goes to b.g.--Lois runs to him-- talks--he exits--the children look after  him--Lois says--
Louis in f.g. talking to herself-- children in b.g.--they come to Lois-- talk to her--put their arms about her --she caresses them--kisses the boy--
Doctor disc--looks off--thoughtful-- looks out window--leans head on hand--
Chief & others disc--door in b.g. opens  & Crittenden enters--talks to chief-- they talk--Crittenden goes to door in  b.g.--opens it--exits--man in corner  rises--
Ladies disc--others coming in--one  seated at desk in f.g.--Lois's friend  talks to them--some excited--
Lois & children disc--maid passes in b.g.  exits--Lois goes to b.g. taking off her  scarf--the children follow her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (END OF REEL FOUR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (REEL FIVE)
Doctor in b.g.--he comes towards f.g.--

Lois comes on in b.g.--woman comes on in f.g.--followed by others--Lois runs to  Priscilla--doctor and others come in-- Priscilla falls onto the chair--the nurse  takes little girl by the hand--leads her  to b.g.--Lois talks to her maid--maid  goes toward b.g.--
Doctor and Priscilla and Lois disc--doctor  questioning her--she says--

The three disc--Priscilla talking--she puts  her handkerchief to her mouth--Lois  startled--she looks off--she goes to b.g. --takes off her hat--doctor leads Priscilla  into the drawing room--Lois follows--they  close the door--

Lois closing the door in b.g.--Priscilla  falls in chair in f.g. sobbing--doctor  brings chair up--Lois sits down beside her --questions Priscilla--puts arm about her --Priscilla bows head on her arm--Lois  looks up at the doctor--speaks to him--he  watches--Priscilla sits up--starts to  speak--the others listen--Priscilla  fumbles with her handkerchief--

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVES INTO INT BEDROOM AMBER
dialogues.text: Priscilla and the three children disc --she tending baby--maid enters with the  bath tub--maid exits in b.g.--little girl  sits on edge of bed --starts to take off  slippers--
George disc--fixing his tie--looking in the  mirror--looks off--laughs--goes to the door --turns out the light--opens the door and  exits--

Priscilla and the children disc--children  getting ready for bed--George comes on-- kisses the little girl--Priscilla rises  with the baby in her arms--looks sternly  at him--speaks to him--he tells her he is  going out--she watches him suspiciously-- calls off--maid comes on--she hands the  baby to the maid--George frowning--biting  his lips--Priscilla speaks to the little  girl--girl talks back to her--saucy--maid  picks up the other child--exits with the  children--Priscilla says--

Priscilla and George disc--she talking --he says she must stay home with the  children--she answers him--he unbuttons  his coat--takes it off--she sits down-- he throws down coat--puts on his  dressing gown--he exits--
Priscilla in b.g.--George comes to f.g.--
Priscilla in b.g.--George in the hall --comes to f.g.--slams the door shut --fastens his gown--
Priscilla seated in f.g.--the children  in nursery in b.g.--

George disc--tying the cord of dressing  gown--gets an idea--opens the door-- slightly--looks out--opens the door-- disclosing Priscilla in the room across  the hall--he goes into the hall--closes  the door--
Priscilla in f.g.--George at door in b.g.
Little girl disc--she turns--crosses the  room--
George in b.g.--Priscilla in f.g.-- George exits--
Priscilla disc--she takes off her  slippers--she rises--runs to b.g.-- exits--
George disc--coming down--he looks back --looks around cautiously--looks up  stairs--goes to b.g.--
George disc--he picks up the phone-- talks--calls number--looks up the  stairs--
Priscilla disc coming down--stops--exits  in f.g.--
George disc--phoning--Priscilla comes  on in door in b.g. listening--he says--

The two disc--George talking on phone-- Priscilla clutches at her throat--he  hangs up the receiver--sets down the  phone--she turns on the light--he  suddenly turns and sees her--she comes  to f.g.--

George and Priscilla disc--he puts arm  about her--she shrinks away from him-- CAMERA PAMS disclosing the foot of  stairs--she starts to exit--he talks to  her--she puts hand over her face--goes  up the stairs--exits--he bows his head--
Priscilla enters in b.g. slams the door --comes to f.g.--hand to her head--
George disc beside the stairs--head bowed--
Priscilla disc--she picks up her husband's  coat --looks at it--clutches it to her-- sits down in rocking chair--buries her  head on her arms-sobbing--IRIS CLOSES--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priscilla--Lois and the doctor disc-- Priscilla talking--Lois looks up at the  doctor--shakes her head--the doctor  turns--goes toward the door--Lois tries  to comfort Priscilla--
George comes on with the maid--stops  her--opens the door--

The three disc--George enters--the maid  comes on in b.g.--George comes to  Priscilla--picks her up--clasps her in  his arms--Lois and the doctor go to the  door--enter the hall and close the door --George holds Priscilla in his arms--
The two disc--George kissing her--she  talking to him--he kisses her forehead --her lips--she talks--puts head on  his shoulder--IRIS CLOSES--
Crowd of women disc at the door--entering  the hall--people on platform in b.g.-- other women come on in f.g.--babies in  their arms-men talk to them--
Women disc--some sit down--one woman exits -

Women disc--with children in arms--Lois  comes on in f.g.--speaks to Sarah-- another woman comes on--Lois pushes her  way thro' the crowd--Priscilla and the  women come on--women crowding in--women  exit in f.g.--
Two women on the platform--Lois--Sarah  and the other women come on with  children--
Crowd disc--trying to get in--women on  the platform in b.g.--women in f.g. clap  their hands--
Lois and the others disc--women sit down  in f.g. with their tables--Lois talks to  some of the other women--three of them  sit down--
Women disc--Crittenden comes on--speaks  to man at the door--
Women disc--one speaking--Lois rises-- comes to the table--
Clapping their hands--
Crittenden and the man disc in f.g.--the  women in b.g.--Lois on the platform-- the old man goes down the aisle toward  b.g.--Crittenden listens--
Lois speaking--the others on the platform --woman comes on--hands her a paper--man  exits--Lois opens the letter--reads--
Lois and one of the other women disc-- she looks at the letter in her hand--
She looks off--staring--
Crittenden disc--frowning--sternly--
Lois and the other women disc--Lois  turns and speaks--one of the women  comes on--takes the letter--
Women disc--one reading the letter-- she talks to Lois--Lois motions--
Crittenden in b.g.--women and little boy  start down the aisle--woman comes and  gets them--takes her back to the seat-- sits down--
Women disc--Lois troubled--do[es]n't  know what to do--the other woman questions  her--Lois nods her head--straightens up-- starts to speak--the other woman sits  down--
Lois speaking--woman beside her taking  notes--
Lois talking--sten taking notes--another  woman in back of her--
Man and woman at the door--Priscilla  comes on in f.g.--Lois in b.g. on the  platform addressing the audience-- Priscilla goes to the doorway--enters  the hall--
As she speaks--earnestly--
As she talks--
Sarah and her friend disc with babies in  arms--woman starts to cough--Sarah puts  arm across her shoulder--
Women disc--some with children--one looks  toward the woman coughing--
Lois and the others disc--Lois talking --all look off--woman in f.g. turns and  looks back--Lois talking excitedly--
Crittenden in f.g.--others in b.g.-- Priscilla looks out of door--officer  comes on--Crittenden speaks to him-- other officers come on--women in f.g. --exit--other men gather about in  f.g.--

dialogues.speaker: OF HALL AMBER
dialogues.text: Lois disc with back turned in f.g.-- Crittenden and the officers enter in  b.g.--Crittenden comes up to the  platform--arrests Lois--
Officers in b.g.--women excited--
The mother with babies disc--Sarah  rises--

Crittenden and the women disc--hand on  Lois' shoulder--he goes down steps--she  follows--the other woman follows--others  excited--Lois makes her way thro' the  crowd--Crittenden follows hand on her  shoulder--
Her baby in her arms--she looks off-- angry-stern--she looks up--she exits--
Crittenden bringing Lois to f.g.--Sarah  mounts the platform--calls to the people--
Sarah with baby in her arms--she talks--
And the other women--Sarah talking-- baby in her arms--she talks excitedly--
Bunch disc--woman exits with two  children in f.g.--officers watching--
Bunch disc--Sarah talking from the  platform--Crittenden and Lois in f.g. --Lois frightened--she pleads with him --officer goes to b.g.
Priscilla and others disc--Priscilla  looks for way of escape and exits--
Women disc--officer takes Sarah away  with him--she clutching at her baby-- he hurries her to f.g. and exits with  her--
Bunch disc--Lois and Crittenden in f.g. --officer bringing Sarah thro' the crowd  to f.g.--the men exit with their prisoners --crowd after them--
Priscilla comes on--takes out nickel-- puts in her call--puts money in slot--
Women disc crowding past--Crittenden  brings Lois to f.g.--makes way through  the mob--officer brings Sarah to f.g. --exits with her in the crowd--

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE AMBER
dialogues.text: Nurse disc--she motions off--speaks--she  exits--doctor comes on--answers the phone--
Priscilla talking on phone--
Doctor talking on phone--questions her --answers--
Talking on phone--excited--
Doctor talking on phone--calls off--takes  off operating gown--nurse comes on with  coat--he puts it on hurriedly--
Crowd of women coming out--exiting--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (END OF REEL FIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (REEL SIX)
IRIS OPENS--Prisoners, lawyers, judge  etc, disc--
Lois, Sarah and others disc--Judge  talking--
Others behind him-
Court in session--lawyer rises-
Dull--speaks--
The prisoners, lawyers and others disc --man speaks to the two women--they  rise--judge pronounces the sentence--
Doctor, Lois and others disc--she goes  towards him--
Bunch disc--John kisses Sarah--tries to  comfort her--judge and doctor go to  Lois--
Lois, Doctor and Judge disc--doctor  talking--she says as title--
Three disc--Lois talking--bitter-- doctor looks at her--judge bows his  head--Lois smiles at the doctor-- speaks--she passes him and exits--he  looks after her--
Prisoners being taken away--they exit  with officers--judge and doctor talking --John talking to his boy in f.g.--boy  crying--John tries to comfort him--John  and the boy exit--
Judge and doctor disc talking--doctor  talks--judge answers--

"To my mind, there is no controversy  about Birth Control, except in so far  as how and by whom it should be  exercised. When a poor woman appears  before me with her sickly, underfed,  unwashed brood of nine children and  says she does not want to take back  her drunken husband because it will  mean another child added to her burden  in a few months, my heart and soul cry  aloud for a law that will permit a  doctor to tell her openly what he has  told the rich woman is secret."  (Extract from speech of Judge John  Stelk, Chicago, February 8, 1917.)
Judge and doctor talking--doctor  thoughtful--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman on witness stand--line of children  seated near--officers of court about--
Talking--crying--lawyer questioning--

Woman on the stand disc--others about-- she talking--child runs to f.g.--another  child stops it--takes mother's purse from  it--mother talking--crying--lawyer  talking--child defies the lawyer--man  rises--interferes--
Seated in chairs--
Bunch disc--man forces the father into  his chair--others sympathetic as the  woman talks--lawyer looks at the child--
CHEMICAL FADE IN--doctor and judge  talking--doctor looks at the judge--

IRIS OPENS--Lois and Sarah disc with  the baby--Lois seated at table--Sarah  in f.g. crying--Lois comes to her-- looks around--woman comes on in the  corridor--the door slides back--guard  comes on--woman enters with tray-- speaks to Lois--Lois speaks to Sarah --urges her to eat--Lois bends over  the baby--woman sets the tray on the  table--woman hands Lois a letter--she  rises and opens it--Sarah starts to  eat--offers Lois a cup of tea--woman  sits down on bed by the baby--Lois  reads the letter--

dialogues.speaker: LETTER AMBER
dialogues.text: My poor Louise,

dialogues.speaker: US ALL.
dialogues.text: Your loving husband
Lois leaning against the bars--breaking  down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children disc playing--Doris and little  brother are chased on by other children-- they are tormented--mud slung at them-- their clothes torn--they start to exit  crying--FADE OUT--
FADE IN--Lois disc--closes her eyes-- tortured at the thought--
The three women disc--Sarah watching Lois --she rises and goes to her--the matron  rises--looks at Lois--speaks to her-- Lois rouses--speaks to the matron--says  as title--

The three women disc--Lois speaking-- looks down at her letter--matron looks  at the letter--Lois talks to her--Sarah  picks up the baby--matron looks at them --Lois talks to Sarah--door is opened-- Sarah enters the corridor--returns and  begs Lois to come with her--she refuses--

Guard and three women disc--Sarah and  the matron trying to persuade Lois to submit--Sarah bows her head--Lois looks  off--pushes Sarah from her--speaks to  the matron--Sarah looks at the guard-- comes to f.g. with the baby--looks back  at Lois--guard takes hold of her arm-- leads her away--they exit--he returns  --matron picks up the tray and exits  in f.g.--guard closes the door--Lois  looks off--he exits--Lois turns and  kneels beside the bed--

Doctor disc--comes to f.g.--Priscilla  and George enter--they question him--he  shakes his head as he answers--he draws  back as the children enter with their  clothes spattered with mud--doctor  questions them--Doris shows her torn  dress--the children crying--they exit  with Priscilla--the two men look after  them--George sympathetic--doctor goes  to b.g.--bows his head--George talks  to him--
Woman inside of cell--raving--guard  comes on--matron passes with tray of  food--PANORAM disclosing Lois's cell --matron enters the cell--guard exits --Lois on her knees beside the bed--
Lois disc kneeling--matron coming on  with the tray--puts it on the bed before  Lois--
Lois kneeling--looking at the tray of  food--
Lois and the matron disc--Lois rises-- refuses the food--matron takes the tray --speaks to Lois--Lois answers--sits  down--matron goes to the door--FADE OUT--
FADE IN--Lois disc--sick--worn out-- looks off--puts her hand to her throat--
Lois seated on the bed--matron enters  followed by a doctor and a nurse--they  offer food to her--she refuses--they  insist--hold her hands--FADE OUT--
FADE IN--Lois, doctor, children and nurse  disc--Lois and doctor under large umbrella --he lays down his book--puts her hand on  her boy's head--doctor talks to her--
Nurse disc reading newspaper--looks off-- looks at the paper--speaks--leans forward--
Party disc--nurse hands the doctor the  paper behind Lois' chair--he takes it-- holds up his glasses and reads--looks  off--
He hands her the paper--thoughtful--she  reads--
Lois and doctor disc--she puts the paper  down and speaks--puts her hand on his--

Sarah and the children disc--John enters-- takes her in his arms--children playing-- he shows her the newspaper--she takes it  and reads--smiling--child runs to f.g.-- exits--John picks up the baby and kisses  it--puts it down--

Lois, doctor and family disc--doctor rises --little girl runs on--falls headlong-- Priscilla and George come on--speak to  doctor and Lois--nurse comes on in b.g.  with two children--all sit down and talk --children playing--Lois hands the paper  to Priscilla--she reads--hands it to  George--he reads--
Looking down--looks off--shrugs his  shoulder and says at title--
Talking--
The party disc--doctor smiles at Lois--
She looks off and speaks--says as title--
Speaking--bows her head--
Looking down--looks off--smiles--speaks--
Talking--
Turns her head and talks--
Talking--looks off--smiling--Doris comes  to her mother--leans against her--Lois  smiles--
Party in f.g.--Doctor, George and  Priscilla watch Lois and Doris--FADE OUT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUBTITLE 10: WHAT DO YOU THINK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: geovisit();
